title: IDENTIFY THE CABLE
fullText:
Before commencing work on a cable, the cable shall be positively identified at the work site by an electrical or non-electrical method of identification.
No work shall begin on a cable unless it is proven that the cable is de-energized.
A cable may be proven de-energized on the basis of â€”
(a) evidence of correct identification; and
(b) evidence of isolation at source.
Where it cannot be proven that a cable is de-energized, controls shall be in place to reduce risk.
NOTE Relevant controls for reducing risk are covered in Clause 4.3.1.
